definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: The line was going out fast but steadily and the fish was not panicked.
sentences.chinese: 钓索朝水中溜得既快又稳，阐明这鱼并不受惊。

sentences.english: The frightened horse ran away from the fire.
sentences.chinese: 受惊的马从火边跑开了。
那马因受惊而后腿直立。

sentences.english: Black mambas are shy and will almost always seek to escape when confronted.
sentences.chinese: 黑曼巴容易受惊，通常遇到时它们会寻求逃离。

sentences.english: The affrighted poultry fled in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 受惊的家禽向四面八方逃去。

sentences.english: The frightened children were clustered together.
sentences.chinese: 受惊吓的小孩子们缩在一块。

sentences.english: That frighted kid tightly grasps his mother's hand.
sentences.chinese: 那个受惊的小孩紧紧地抓住他母亲的手。

sentences.english: If you enjoy the feeling of being scared, you will love this film.
sentences.chinese: 如果你喜欢受惊吓的感觉，你会喜欢这部电影。

sentences.english: Don't be so easily frightened, you are a big boy now.
sentences.chinese: 你已成大孩子了，不要那样容易受惊吓。

sentences.english: Horses have a well-developed instinct for fear.
The invaders' war elephants bolted, killing vast numbers of soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 侵略者的战象受惊吓而狂奔，踩死了大量士兵。

sentences.english: Aerie as the frightened little girl in the circus would be amazed at her transformation.
sentences.chinese: 那些把艾黎团里位受惊吓女孩，她蜕感非常惊讶。

sentences.english: The child was more frighted than hurt.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子伤倒算什么，只是受惊不小。

sentences.english: The affrighted friends jumped from the table in the consternation.
sentences.chinese: 这两个受惊的朋友万分恐惧地从桌上跳下来。

sentences.english: The startled ox dashed about in all directions in the fields.
sentences.chinese: 牛受惊了，在田地里四处奔突。

definition: see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
lit. a bird startled by the mere twang of a bow (idiom)/fig. sb who frightens easily, due to past experiences
